events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the main street. Claim filing initiated accordingly.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of keywords in the initial report and description.
An insurance agent specializing in vehicle claims was assigned to handle the collision case swiftly and efficiently.
Acknowledgement of claim sent to customer, reassuring them that the process has begun and support is available.
Requested documents including police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates to proceed with investigation.
Customer submitted all required documents on time, which included the accident report and mechanic’s damage assessment.
Investigation into the vehicle collision began, focusing on cause, liability, and extent of damage reported.
The investigation concluded with findings supporting the customer’s claim of a collision caused by a third party.
A settlement offer covering full vehicle repairs and rental costs was proposed to the customer for approval.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the coverage provided.
Claim approval finalized after customer consented to settlement terms and documentation was completed.
Payment for vehicle repair costs was processed and issued to the customer’s designated account.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after all payments were made and customer confirmed case resolution.
